column1: -da is a Quenya suffix that has three meanings.
Used to denoting the passive result of the action
column2: and when used substantivally a single product of this. Tolkien notes that "dā (variant of nā)" and "in practice words denoting products are found made with either dā or tā (lengthening owing to the influence of dā)"

column1: Used in a noun designating the result of an action.

column2: indicating resulting products of an action.
